page.title: 02THE CHURCH
page.content: {The Church} Parts of the church building are 900 years old and it is the most imposing building in the village. The present incumbent is also responsible for the parish church of the village of Laverstoke. There is a graveyard which is still being used as a burial ground but not all the people in the village who die are buried there. There are many regular weekly services held, most of them on Sunday. The Church which is dedicated to St. Mary is the only church in the village. There is a Methodist Chapel and other religious groups use various halls in the village except the Roman Catholics. They use St. Mary's to celebrate Mass every Sunday at 9 a.m. in a practical example of the current ecumenical movement.
